abstract: Gareth Pugh lends his gothic-abstract aesthetic to Melissa's signature plastic shoes.
snippet: Gareth Pugh lends his gothic-abstract aesthetic to Melissa's signature plastic shoes.
lead_paragraph: "Basically they asked me, and I said O.K.," says the designer Gareth Pugh of his easy decision to collaborate with Melissa, the Brazilian shoe company best known for making synthetic vegan footwear with designers like Vivienne Westwood, Jason Wu and Jean Paul Gaultier. In fact, Pugh says that working with Melissa - a brand that took an early interest in his work (it helped sponsor his second fashion show back in 2006) - on his first-ever shoe collection and most mainstream venture yet feels "like a natural move." The six-piece Melissa + Gareth Pugh spring collection, which recently had its debut in Rio de Janeiro, was perfected via a steady stream of intercontinental e-mails in which Pugh would "tweak this, change that." "I'm a Virgo," he explains. "I'm very particular about how I want things to be." Here, Pugh's gothic-abstract aesthetic in Melissa's signature plastic: an exoskeletal sandal that inches over the ankle with a trio of vertebrae-like pieces in combinations of black, white and silver.
